greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of simple connected graphs on n unlabeled nodes with k articulation vertices, (0 <= k < n).
comment: Articulation vertices are also called cutpoints. These are vertices that when removed increase the component count of the graph.
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Articulation Vertex
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 05 2019
